plugin.name: ðŸ–¥ï¸ Window Tools
plugin.description: Tools to help manage NotePlan windows on macOS, notably save and restore particular window layouts ('Window Sets').
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
v1.0.0: 3 new commands, and renamed plugin from 'Window Sets'. Also moved 3 window-related commands from 'Note Helpers' plugin.
v0.4.0: First public release, and requires NP v3.9.8.

plugin.commands.name: open window set
plugin.commands.description: Open a saved set of windows/panes
arguments: Saved Window Set name to open

plugin.commands.name: save window set
plugin.commands.description: Save the current windows/panes as a named set

plugin.commands.name: constrain main window
plugin.commands.description: Constrain main window, so it actually all shows on the screen

plugin.commands.name: move split to main
plugin.commands.description: Move current split window to be the main window

plugin.commands.name: open note in new window
plugin.commands.description: Open a user-selected note in a new window.

plugin.commands.name: open note in new split
plugin.commands.description: Open a user-selected note in a new split of the main window

plugin.commands.name: open current in new split
plugin.commands.description: Open the current note again in a new split of the main window

plugin.commands.name: open current in new window
plugin.commands.description: Open the current note again in a new floating window

plugin.commands.name: test: write window set pref to note
plugin.commands.description: Write WS local preference to note

plugin.commands.name: test: write window set note to pref
plugin.commands.description: Write WS note to local preference

plugin.commands.name: test: sync window set note to pref
plugin.commands.description: Sync WS note to local WS preference

plugin.commands.name: test: set editor width
plugin.commands.description: Set width of an open editor, by its index

plugin.commands.name: test:delete window set
plugin.commands.description: Delete a saved set of windows/panes

plugin.commands.name: test: delete all saved Window Sets

plugin.settings.title: Note title for Window Set definitions
plugin.settings.description: Note title for where Window Set definitions are visible.

plugin.settings.title: Folder name for Window Set definitions
plugin.settings.description: Folder where Window Set definitions are visible.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing Tidy commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs
